intro: Mesanthemum, commonly known as the "white crown" or "white star," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aizoaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. Mesanthemum species typically thrive in arid or semi-arid environments, making them well-suited for xerophytic conditions. They are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to withstand periods of drought. The flowers, which are usually white or pale pink, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
